subject: Critical Thinking
title: Hasty Generalization: One Example Isn't a Pattern
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Hasty Generalization: One Example Isn't a Pattern.

hook.text: 'I met a rude person from that country. People from there must be rude.' One data point. 7 billion people. Sure.

buildup.text: Hasty generalization: drawing a broad conclusion from a sample that's too small or unrepresentative.

twist.text: Media amplifies this: one plane crash creates 'flying is dangerous.' One tech CEO success creates 'drop out of college.'

climax.text: Good reasoning asks: How large is the sample? Is it representative? Are there counterexamples?

punchline.text: Anecdotes are not data. No matter how vivid.

quiz.question: What makes a hasty generalization fallacious?
options: Drawing conclusions too quickly in time
Drawing broad conclusions from a sample that's too small or unrepresentative
